name: Black Owned Maine (BOM)
description: This organization is dedicated to sustaining and innovating an ecosystem for Black entrepreneurs in Maine. They offer business consulting, entrepreneurial training, and maintain a Black business directory. They focus on providing culturally responsive and community-driven support
services: Black-owned Business formation in Maine consultation

name: Maine Black Chamber of Commerce (MBCC)
address: 65 Stone Street, Augusta, ME 04330 (This is a listed address for the organization.)
description: The MBCC works to stimulate economic growth and advocate for the business interests of Black businesses in Maine. They provide advocacy, networking opportunities, and resources to support Black businesses, entrepreneurs, and professionals
services: Black-owned Business formation in Maine consultation

name: The Third Place
description: This organization aims to create connections within the Black community in Maine through networking and events. They also work to foster a strong Black business and professional community, offering a co-working space
services: Black-owned Business formation in Maine consultation

name: ByBlack
description: ByBlack is a platform that aims to connect consumers with Black-owned businesses. While not specific to Maine, it is a resource for finding Black-owned businesses, and may list businesses in Maine
services: Black-owned Business formation in Maine consultation

name: The Black Community Shoppe
description: This platform hosts a directory of Black-owned businesses. While it is a national directory, it may include businesses located in Maine
services: Black-owned Business formation in Maine consultation
